body.name: Utopia Care Professional Barber Straight Edge Razor Safety with 100-Pack Derby Blades - 100 Percent Stainless Steel (Black)

features: PREMIUM QUALITY – A box of 100 genuine blades by derby which is the best in market. Each blade is individually wax paper wrapped, that will outlast through many shaves. The professional quality Razor can be used both at home and in barbershops

SMOOTH GRIP – It features a flip-able blade cover with a comfortable metal grip, allowing easy maneuvering and a close shave. Start with gentle strokes and slowly work your way around to keep a steady motion and pressure
DURABLE - The black matte finish over the stainless steel body helps deter rust for long-lasting performance. Hence, this razor provides a perfect shaving experience
ERGONOMIC DESIGN – A classically styled straight edge barber razor made of brass with a chrome finish offering a reliable and silken shave every time

SAFETY TIPS – For safe usage at all times, make sure that the blade is locked securely within the safety walls and the cap is in place. Be sure to gently squeeze the protection cap before closing it to ensure a tight and secure grip. If the walls become loose with time, push them with a small amount of pressure when placing the blade and lock the cap

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Ergonomic Design Easy-to-master design with a rounded edge assists in providing a safe and secure shave. Its smooth grip helps you easily get rid of overgrown facial hair. Rest your initial three fingers on the back of the blade, the last one on the blade’s tank and your thumb on the side of the blade, close to the center, for a perfect shaving experience.

Rust-Free 430-Grade Stainless Steel Designed to perfection, using the finest of stainless steel, this razor pulls off a seamless shave every time. The disposable blade pack allows you to switch from an old and rusty blade to a new, clean one. It's made using the 430-Grade Japanese Stainless Steel construction that makes it rust-free and last longer.

Easy Grip Hold your razor by resting your initial three fingers at the back of the blade. Now rest your pinky finger on the blade’s tank and using a slight pressure, place your thumb on the side of the blade close to the center to have a comfortable grip of the razor. This grasp will ensure that you have the most comfortable shave. Shaving Guide Applying The Best Shave Stroke: Start stroking your skin with moderate strokes and move toward your whiskers in an even movement. Once there, you need to hold the sharp edge at a 30-degree edge. Just be mindful that you do not need to apply any weight when you shave and allow the sturdy design of the blade do the work itself. Ultimate Shaving Experience Our superior design is expertly weighted, agreeable in your grasp, and gives you more noteworthy control and adjust than numerous different razors available. Say goodbye to cuts and scratches. Save razor consumption and welcome an additional nearby wrap-up to your shaving accessories. Ideal for a touchy skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First time using a straight edge and I only had one minor nick! I got this because I have a very thick beard and let it grow a bit between shavings and it’s impossible to use a safety razor once it grows beyond a certain length.This has been the perfect solution. It glides right through my heavy beard.If you’re in a similar situation, you may want to give it a try. But anyone who shaves daily would probably not need it and would be better served with a safety razor.UPDATE: I just shaved my head. Not bad results for the first time. Few nicks. The trick is to start with the blade nearly flat against your skin and then angle the blade to 30 degrees as you stroke. So you’re alway approaching your face with the blade flat.Good luck!

reviews.reviewText: So I’ve ordered two of these in black and one in blue. The black version is a lot nicer overall because simply because it doesn’t feel as cheap as the blue version one. I actually returned the blue one and got another black one. The blue one feels cheap and not as nice

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: You get blades plus handle for the price of just the blades. Handle is made of metal and feels good in the hand. Derby premiums are about the best blades you can get IMHO and are worth the price on their own. Here u get blades AND a holder.... really a no brainer for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not bad for the price.
reviews.reviewText: I've been using a straight-edge razor for a little over a year now using a typical "old fashioned" blade and decided to give this a shot for a variety of reasons.The price: You get what you pay for. I paid $9.99 for this razor and 100 derby blades. The razor itself, or razor caddy to be more specific, is decent. It's stainless steel and of good construction. The blade is held firmly in place just as it should be. The problem is that the two dots for alignment inside the enclosure are slightly off so the edge of the blade is at a different angle than the edge of the caddy, they should be parallel and they're not. This seems like a minor problem, but when you're working with something that is barely extending beyond the edge of the caddy, you have to use the caddy for alignment on your face either by sight or touch - but this creates a perception problem and if you're not extra careful you'll end up slicing your face/neck instead of shaving it. If the alignment were better, this would be a superb product. Perhaps mine is just faulty? Your mileage may vary.Speaking of slicing your neck, this brings me to the Derby blades that came with it. My first shave with it went well - just as I'm accustomed to with my prior razor. It took a few strokes before I realized the alignment problem, but once that was figured out I was able to adjust. My second shave was a decidedly different story. If you've never used a single, ultra-sharp blade before, then you may not realize that when something is THIS sharp you don't feel pain right away when you cut yourself. That was what happened with the second shave - my neck was sliced in many places. Once the blood started flowing from multiple cuts, I stopped and inspected what was going on. The blade had a nick in it. Because the first didn't, I assumed this was a fluke. I took the blade out and put a new one in, only to realize this 3rd blade was nicked also. I then opened up 10 more of the individually wrapped blades and 7 of them had flaws that would cause this problem. Out of the 13 total blades that I have opened so far, 9 of them were unusable for shaving. The box containing the blades was slightly askew when I received it, and was definitely damaged during shipping but the blades looked fine until I inspected them specifically looking for imperfections in the blade edge. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that this is not their quality control but was instead a shipping issue, but I recommend you be very careful if you do order this product. They're delicate.Doing further research it seems Derby blades are far from ideal. Their thinness accounts for how easily they're damaged and become unusable. Even the undamaged blades only gave a really good shave for 3/4's of my face/neck before dulling. I am able to complete a full shave, but it's less smooth near the end due to the rapid dulling of the blade. Some people report getting a second shave from each one, maybe I was just spoiled with how long my standard straight-edge was able to hold a shave-ready edge.Short version: Quality of the blades is lacking, find different blades to use with the caddy. Quick research will show you the best alternatives. The razor/caddy is good, but would be great if it held the blade parallel for easier use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use these to shave my legs. I don't think my husband is lying buy idk if he just don't want to get in trouble haha but sometimes the blades I put in it just aren't there when I go to use it. I asked if he disposed if it but he said no. It has a good locking system and doesn't come loose so idk where they are going. I don't find lose blades anywhere. Will buy again.

reviews.reviewerName: Extremely Good quality with perfect functioning.
reviews.reviewText: Amazing Product with durability and finest quality of blades.

Al principio desconfíe ya que por el precio pensé que en el segundo uso se iba a romper, pero no, todo lo contrario a veces soy descuidado y la llegó a dejar en la regadera por lo cual está a la intemperie de la humedad de cualquiera que se meta a bañar, lo que quiero decir es que hasta el momento ni siquiera presenta corrosión y el paquete de navajas que vienen incluidas son excelentes para su uso. El peso es bastante aceptable ya que es ligera pero no como para que se te este resbalando como si fuera un juguete. Super recomendado!
Saw this being used on YouTube. Gives a great shave. Worth checking out videos on how to hold it. Blades came in halves. Very handy.

Strike fear in your enemies heart, step in with your war face. Make your ancestors feel proud watching you shave from sovngarde. Use the timeless technology, from dovahkinn to Tony Montana, there's nothing like getting a fresh warm cut on your face first thing in the morning, tell your coworkers the tale of your battles and your scars.Just like snowflakes each scar is unique but lasts months.

Es la primera navaja de este tipo que compro, así que no tengo punto de comparación; sin embargo, se siente que es de calidad y estoy 100% satisfecho. Se necesita algo de práctica para evitar Cortes, pero los resultados son notablemente mejor que con otras técnicas de afeitado (queda más al raz y mejor delineada la barba y el bigote)
